title: Enabling Collaborative Clinical Diagnosis of Infectious Keratitis by Integrating Expert Knowledge and Interpretable Data-driven Intelligence. (arXiv:2401.08695v1 [cs.AI])
abstract: Although data-driven artificial intelligence (AI) in medical image diagnosis has shown impressive performance in silico, the lack of interpretability makes it difficult to incorporate the "black box" into clinicians' workflows. To make the diagnostic patterns learned from data understandable by clinicians, we develop an interpretable model, knowledge-guided diagnosis model (KGDM), that provides a visualized reasoning process containing AI-based biomarkers and retrieved cases that with the same diagnostic patterns. It embraces clinicians' prompts into the interpreted reasoning through human-AI interaction, leading to potentially enhanced safety and more accurate predictions. This study investigates the performance, interpretability, and clinical utility of KGDM in the diagnosis of infectious keratitis (IK), which is the leading cause of corneal blindness. translated_title: 通过整合专家知识和可解释的数据驱动智能实现传染性角膜炎的协同临床诊断
translated_abstract: 尽管基于数据驱动的人工智能在医学图像诊断方面表现出色，但其缺乏可解释性使得将“黑盒子”融入临床工作流程变得困难。为了使从数据中学到的诊断模式对临床医生可理解，我们开发了一个可解释的模型，即知识引导诊断模型（KGDM），它提供了一个可视化的推理过程，包含基于人工智能的生物标记和具有相同诊断模式的检索病例。通过人工智能与人类的互动，KGDM将临床医生的提示融入到解释推理中，从而可能提高安全性和更准确的预测。本研究探讨了KGDM在传染性角膜炎（IK）诊断中的性能、可解释性和临床实用性，IK 是角膜失明的主要原因。 KGDM 的分类性能在一组前瞻性验证数据集、外部测试数据集和一个公开数据集上进行了评估。
tldr: 通过整合专家知识和可解释的数据驱动智能，本研究提出了一种知识引导诊断模型（KGDM），用于协同临床诊断传染性角膜炎（IK）。KGDM通过与临床医生的互动，提供可视化推理过程，包括AI基于生物标记和具有相同诊断模式的病例。这一方法有望提高安全性和预测准确性。
en_tdlr: This study proposes a knowledge-guided diagnosis model (KGDM) that integrates expert knowledge and interpretable data-driven intelligence for collaborative clinical diagnosis of infectious keratitis (IK). KGDM provides a visualized reasoning process, incorporating AI-based biomarkers and retrieved cases with the same diagnostic patterns, through human-AI interaction. It has the potential to enhance safety and improve prediction accuracy.
